definition: lit. to allay one's hunger using a picture of a cake/to feed on illusions (idiom)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
round flat cake/cookie/cake/pastry/CL:張|张[zhang1]
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
hungry
variant of 飢|饥[ji1]

sentences.english: He giggled/chuckled and said, “This is called ‘ drawing a cake to satisfy one’s hunger’.”
sentences.chinese: 他咯咯的笑着说，“这叫做画饼充饥”。

sentences.english: Can look at the family's website only, him feed on illusions.
sentences.chinese: 只能看着人家的网站，自己画饼充饥。

sentences.english: The idiom came from what the emperor said.
sentences.chinese: 成语“画饼充饥”就来自于皇帝所说的话。

definition: lit. to quench one's thirst by thinking of plums (idiom)/fig. to console oneself with illusions
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
lit. to scoop the moon out of the water (idiom)/a hopeless endeavor
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
prattle/idle chit-chat
dream of golden millet/fig. illusions of wealth and power/pipe dream
all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
to daydream/to indulge in wishful thinking
all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
to be all talk and no action
daydream/fantasy/to fantasize
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
